noun.description: A member of a North American Indian people, or confederacy, inhabiting the upper waters of the James River of Virginia in the Colonial Period. Also: a present-day group in Amherst County, Virginia, claiming descent from these.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Monacans.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Instruccions. Origin unknown<br>late 19th century; earliest use found in Appletons' Journal. From Monaco, the name of a principality on the Mediterranean coast of France + -an.
